randomized_controlled_trial.name: Randomized Controlled Trial
randomized_controlled_trial.description: A study in which participants are randomly assigned to treatment or control groups

observational_study.name: Observational Study
observational_study.description: A study that observes participants without intervention

case_control.name: Case-Control Study
case_control.description: A study comparing participants with a specific outcome to those without

cohort_study.name: Cohort Study
cohort_study.description: A study following groups of participants over time

cross_sectional.name: Cross-Sectional Study
cross_sectional.description: A study examining participants at a single point in time

pragmatic_trial.name: Pragmatic Trial
pragmatic_trial.description: A trial designed to test interventions in real-life conditions

adaptive_trial.name: Adaptive Trial
adaptive_trial.description: A trial that allows modifications based on interim analyses

feasibility_study.name: Feasibility Study
feasibility_study.description: A study to assess the practicality of a proposed intervention or protocol

background.title: Background
prompts: What is the current state of knowledge in this field?
What are the key gaps in current research?
What preliminary data supports this study?
Why is this study important for clinical practice?
What are the potential impacts on patient care?
How does this study build on previous research?
What is the theoretical framework for this study?

objectives.title: Objectives
prompts: What is the primary research question (PICO format)?
What are the secondary research questions?
What are the specific hypotheses to be tested?
What is the null hypothesis?
What are the exploratory objectives?
How do these objectives align with the study design?
What is the minimum clinically important difference?

study_design.title: Study Design
prompts: What is the overall study design?
What are the key study phases?
What is the study timeline?

population.title: Study Population
prompts: Who is eligible to participate?
How will participants be recruited?
How was the sample size determined?

randomization.title: Randomization
prompts: How will randomization be performed?
How will allocation be concealed?
Who will implement the randomization?

interventions.title: Interventions
prompts: What are the study interventions?
How will they be administered?
How will compliance be monitored?

outcomes.title: Outcome Measures
prompts: What is the primary outcome measure?
What are the secondary outcome measures?
How will outcomes be measured?

statistical_analysis.title: Statistical Analysis
prompts: What statistical methods will be used?
How will missing data be handled?
Will there be interim analyses?

safety.title: Safety Monitoring
prompts: How will adverse events be monitored?
What are the stopping rules?
How will safety data be reported?

ethics.title: Ethical Considerations
prompts: What ethical approvals are needed?
How will informed consent be obtained?
How will data privacy be maintained?

timeline.title: Study Timeline
prompts: What is the study schedule?
What are key milestones?
When will results be available?

data_management.title: Data Management
prompts: How will data be collected?
How will data quality be ensured?
How will data be stored and secured?

references.title: References
prompts: What are the key references?
What guidelines were followed?
What related studies exist?

implementation.title: Implementation
prompts: How will sites be prepared for the study?
What training will be provided to staff?
How will intervention fidelity be monitored?
What are the quality control measures?
How will protocol deviations be handled?
What support systems will be in place?

adaptation_rules.title: Adaptation Rules
prompts: What are the planned adaptation points?
What are the decision rules for adaptations?
How will type I error be controlled?
What are the stopping boundaries?
How will sample size be reassessed?
What simulation evidence supports the adaptation plan?

feasibility_outcomes.title: Feasibility Outcomes
prompts: What recruitment rate is considered feasible?
What retention rate is acceptable?
How will intervention adherence be measured?
What resources are needed for full trial?
What are the key progression criteria?
How will protocol feasibility be assessed?

cost_effectiveness.title: Cost-Effectiveness
prompts: How will costs be measured and valued?
What is the primary economic outcome?
What perspective will the analysis take?
What time horizon will be used?
How will uncertainty be handled?
What sensitivity analyses are planned?

stakeholder_engagement.title: Stakeholder Engagement
prompts: How are stakeholders involved in design?
How will stakeholder input be incorporated?
What are the engagement strategies?
How will feedback be collected and used?
How will results be disseminated?
What is the communication plan?

quality_control.title: Quality Control
prompts: What quality control procedures will be implemented?
How will data quality be monitored and validated?
What quality metrics will be tracked?
How will quality issues be identified and addressed?
What corrective action procedures are in place?
How will protocol compliance be ensured?

data_collection.title: Data Collection
prompts: What methods will be used to collect data?
What are the primary data sources?
What measurement tools and instruments will be used?
How will data quality be ensured during collection?
What is the data collection schedule?
How will missing data be handled?

matching_criteria.title: Matching Criteria
prompts: What variables will be used for matching?
What is the matching ratio?
How will matching be performed?
How will the quality of matching be assessed?

progression_criteria.title: Progression Criteria
prompts: What are the criteria for progression to a full trial?
What thresholds indicate feasibility?
What would trigger protocol modifications?
How will the progression decision be made?

interim_analyses.title: Interim Analyses
prompts: When will interim analyses be conducted?
What are the stopping rules?
What decision criteria will be used?
How will type I error be controlled?

case_definition.title: Case Definition
prompts: How are cases defined?
How will cases be identified?
How will case status be validated?

control_definition.title: Control Definition
prompts: How are controls defined?
How will controls be selected?
What is the source population?

exposure_assessment.title: Exposure Assessment
prompts: How is exposure defined?
How will exposure be measured?
How will exposure data be validated?

follow_up.title: Follow-up
prompts: How long is the follow-up period?
What are the follow-up procedures?
How will participant retention be maximized?

simulation_results.title: Simulation Results
prompts: What scenarios were simulated?
What are the type I error rates?
What is the power under different scenarios?
How variable is the final sample size?
What are the stopping probabilities?
How robust are the adaptation rules?

process_evaluation.title: Process Evaluation
prompts: How will implementation be assessed?
What mechanisms will be evaluated?
How will context be analyzed?
What are potential barriers/facilitators?
How will findings inform future work?
What qualitative methods will be used?
